name: 楊侑倫
objective:
This course aims to provide an in-depth understanding of the various mechanical properties of engineering materials. Content covers the behavior of materials under different loading and environmental conditions, including elastic deformation, plastic deformation, hardness, impact toughness, fatigue, and creep. Students will learn the principles and methods for testing these properties and will gain hands-on experience through laboratory sessions. The course emphasizes the integration of theory and practice, enabling students to apply knowledge of material mechanical properties to engineering design and material selection. Specific teaching weeks will include laboratory sessions, online teaching, and open-book exams, requiring active student participation, data collection, and discussion.

Important Course Notes

International Student Friendly: This course is designed to be welcoming and supportive for international students.

Language of Instruction and Assessment: For all students (domestic and international), all questions, presentations, and examinations must be completed in English.

Laboratory Requirement: This course includes several laboratory sessions. Experimental results and reports will be discussed in class and will form an important basis for continuous assessment.

Open-Book Exam Procedure: For open-book exams, students must come to the classroom to collect the exam paper, then may proceed to the library to research and answer the questions. Answers and findings will be discussed collectively at the end of the relevant class session.

Online Teaching Weeks: Specific teaching weeks will be conducted online. Please check the Microsoft Teams for access details and materials.


本課程旨在深入探討工程材料的各種機械性質。內容涵蓋材料在不同負載與環境條件下的行為，包括彈性變形、塑性變形、硬度、衝擊韌性、疲勞與潛變等。學生將學習這些性質的測試原理與方法，並透過實驗課實際操作相關測試。課程強調理論與實務結合，使學生能將材料機械性質的知識應用於工程設計與材料選用。特定教學週將包含實驗課程、線上教學及開書考試，要求學生主動參與並進行資料搜集與研討。

課程重要事項 (Important Course Notes)

國際學生友善課程： 本課程致力於為國際學生營造一個友善且具支持性的學習環境。

授課與評量語言： 所有學生（含本地生及國際學生）的課堂提問、口頭報告及所有考試均需使用英文完成。

實驗課程要求： 本課程包含多次實驗課。實驗結果與報告將於課堂中討論，並作為平時考核之重要依據。

開書考試程序： 開書考試時，學生須至教室領取試題，隨後可至圖書館查詢資料以完成作答。答案及研討成果將於該次課程結束前進行討論。

線上教學週： 特定教學週將採線上教學。請留意 Microsoft Teams 以獲取登入詳情及教材。

All students are required to participate in the 2025 SEYI Cup (AI in Servo Stamping). Week 9 = hard submission deadline.

Weekly Plan (English) — Front-loaded for Week 9 deadline

Week 1 — Intro & SEYI Cup Kickoff
Syllabus; safety; team formation (3–4); topic & KPI draft; toolchain (MATLAB/Python/FE I/O).

Week 2 — Servo Stamping Fundamentals
Mechanics/controls; motion profiles (dwell/pendulum/trapezoid); energy & tonnage; Project M1: Problem statement + KPI + data needs.

Week 3 — Computer Coding Class #1
Motion-profile scripting; load–stroke data structures; plotting; In-Class Assignment #1: baseline motion set + visualization.

Week 4 (Online) — Forming Basics w/ Servo Motion
Yield criteria, FLD, tribology; Deliverable: literature review outline + baseline plan.

Week 5 — Open-Book Exam #1 & In-Class Assignment #2
Open-book (short). Assignment #2: parameter sweep (5 profiles) with energy/peak-tonnage estimates; critique session.

Week 6 — Data & Quick Simulation Sprint
Signal processing; quick load–stroke sim; pre/post templates; M2 Checkpoint: methods draft + initial results (2–3 figures).

Week 7 — In-Class Assignment #3 (Optimization Mini-Sprint)
Tune profiles vs thinning/energy; prepare 5-slide interim deck; peer review.

Week 8 (Online) — Submission Rehearsal
Full report/code/slides peer review; freeze list; compliance check; M3: near-final package.

Week 9 — SEYI Cup Submission & Demo (HARD DEADLINE)
Submit final package; in-class dry demo if required by organizer.

Midterm moved to Week 10 (was Week 9).

Week 10 — Midterm Examination (moved)
Reflection on competition outcomes; gap analysis.

Week 11 — Process Modeling for Stamping
Plane-stress plasticity; constitutive laws; contact/friction/heat; FE setup for servo motion.

Week 12 — In-Class Assignment #4
Case analysis (cup drawing): compare motion profiles using provided results; draw-in/thinning/wrinkle risks; recommendation memo.

Week 13 (Online) — Coding Workflows
Batch runs; FLD checks; parameter studies; reporting templates.

Week 14 — Open-Book Exam #2 & Optimization Loops
Multi-objective trade-offs; simple optimizers.

Week 15 — Advanced Subroutine Validation
Predicted vs measured tonnage; friction calibration; uncertainty notes.

Week 16 — Advanced Subroutines & Digital Twin
Implementation + alignment.

Week 17 — Course Summary & Review
Patterns, checklists, code hygiene.

Week 18 — Final Examination
